intro: Pseudolysimachion septentrionale, commonly known as the northern pseudolysimachion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its succulent stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its botanical features make it well-suited for survival in harsh, high-latitude environments.
